title: Senior Content Manager - Philippines
content:
Title:                                           SENIOR CONTENT MANAGER
Directly Reports to:                   OPERATIONS MANAGER
 
 
Role
The Senior Content Manager (SCM) leverages on social media content to bring brand ideas and stories to life. The SCM leads brands into fresh creative territories through the skilled use of language and visual design in conveying messages, thoughts and feelings. This involves the planning, production, and publishing of online and social media content. The SCM also supports Ogilvy’s Social Media Team when it comes to thought leadership, opportunity spotting, quality assurance, team training, and new business hunting.
 
 
Scope of Work
 

 Social Media Management


Create, execute, and update social media content plans, shot lists, event guides, influencer guides, response spiels, and other applicable requirements designed to meet marketing and campaign objectives, in collaboration with teammates. This will involve development of both planned and ad-hoc content, as well as scheduling and publishing approved materials on social media.
Content development includes research, content ideation, copywriting, and graphic design.

If graphic design skills are lacking, willingness to develop graphic design skills via rigid training and self-study must be present.


Support the team’s weekly Work-In-Progress (WIP) meetings, as well as other projects and initiatives of the Social Media Team
Help set up social hub projects and, if need be, function as interim content leads.
Provide leadership and consultation to the junior content managers, as well as render quality assurance support by reviewing and building on their output.
Help produce social media playbooks and other relevant reference materials that will streamline content treatment, standard protocols and ensure efficient service delivery.
Physical presence at events that require live content compilation, production, and publication.


Participation in shoots for social content to ensure shot list is executed correctly
Willingness to work outside the Philippines for short-term regional projects.
May be deployed as backup support for local team members who are part of social hubs embedded in client’s office.

This secondment setup may require reporting to the Client office, where the schedule and work hours will be agreed upon with the Client.


 

 Social Media Consultation


Support the business development team in terms of developing proposals that require sample content and responses
Conduct social media community audits to spot opportunities and determine improvement areas specific to service level agreements.
Participate in brainstorming sessions related to social media content creation and response management.
Maintain a constant awareness of general online trends and conversations related to their overall scope of work, to better deal with opportunities and issues.

 
Requirements
 

Degree in Multimedia Arts/Communications/PR/Marketing/Social Sciences or similar studies
At least 3-4 years of experience in social media management or in a related field in digital marketing, customer management or public relations
Demonstrable experience in creative ideation and copywriting
Skills in photoshop and illustration (or at least possess the willingness to learn such graphic design capabilities through rigid training and self-study)
Possession of creative flair, versatility, conceptual/visual ability and originality
Skills in photography a plus
Passion for all things social media - staying on top of latest trend, platform updates, as well as local nuances of consumer behavior
Written fluency in both English and the local language a must
Must have good own online reputation

Desired Qualities

Team player, comfortable working in a team and individually
Time efficiency and ability to multi-task and manage priority-driven tasks
Inspires confidence and teamwork
Engaging, outgoing, and outspoken

 
 
 At Ogilvy, our people are at the heart of what we do: a creative agency that sparks game-changing ideas across culture and business through collaboration, integrity, and a celebration of self-expression. 
We believe in building powerful teams with purpose. This means hiring and nurturing talent across all races, ethnicities, religions, abilities, sexual orientation, and gender identities – and we relentlessly curate transformative initiatives that make our commitment to fairness, and equity a reality. 
Our ultimate mission is to leave a positive impact on the world, creating a better future for all, while supporting and uplifting the global communities we serve.  This is central to our mantra of Borderless Creativity.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.
